ai-mn118:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother, together with several well-known senior disciples, such as
ai-mn118:1.3_0: the venerables Sāriputta, Mahāmoggallāna, Mahākassapa, Mahākaccāna, Mahākoṭṭhita, Mahākappina, Mahācunda, Anuruddha, Revata, Ānanda, and others.
ai-mn118:2.1_0: Now at that time the senior mendicants were advising and instructing the junior mendicants.
ai-mn118:2.2_0: Some senior mendicants instructed ten mendicants, while some instructed twenty, thirty, or forty.
ai-mn118:2.3_0: Being instructed by the senior mendicants, the junior mendicants realized a higher distinction than they had before.
ai-mn118:3.1_0: Now, at that time it was the sabbath—the full moon on the fifteenth day—and the Buddha was sitting in the open surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
ai-mn118:3.2_0: Then the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed them:
ai-mn118:4.1_0: “I am satisfied, mendicants, with this practice.
ai-mn118:4.2_0: My heart is satisfied with this practice.
ai-mn118:4.3_0: So you should rouse up even more energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-mn118:4.4_0: I will wait here in Sāvatthī for the Komudi full moon of the fourth month.”
ai-mn118:5.1_0: The monks in the country heard:
ai-mn118:5.2_0: “The Buddha will be right there at Sāvatthī until the fourth month of Komudī comes,”
ai-mn118:5.3_0: and came down to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.
ai-mn118:6.1_0: And those senior mendicants instructed the junior mendicants even more.
ai-mn118:6.2_0: Some senior mendicants instructed ten mendicants, while some instructed twenty, thirty, or forty.
ai-mn118:6.3_0: Being instructed by the senior mendicants, the junior mendicants realized a higher distinction than they had before.
ai-mn118:7.1_0: Now, at that time it was the sabbath—the Komudi full moon on the fifteenth day of the fourth month—and the Buddha was sitting in the open surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
ai-mn118:7.2_0: Then the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed them:
ai-mn118:8.1_0: “The assembly, mendicants, is without frivolous speech; the assembly is pure, grounded in purification.
ai-mn118:8.2_0: Such is this Saṅgha of monks, such is this assembly!
ai-mn118:8.3_0: An assembly such as this is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-mn118:8.4_0: Such is this Saṅgha of monks, such is this assembly!
ai-mn118:8.5_0: Even a small gift to an assembly such as this is plentiful.
ai-mn118:8.6_0: Such is this Saṅgha of monks, such is this assembly!
ai-mn118:8.7_0: An assembly such as this is rarely seen in the world.
ai-mn118:8.8_0: Such is this Saṅgha of monks, such is this assembly!
ai-mn118:8.9_0: An assembly such as this is worth traveling many leagues to see, even if you have to carry your own provisions in a shoulder bag.
ai-mn118:9.1_0: For in this Saṅgha there are perfected mendicants, who have ended the defilements, completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and are rightly freed through enlightenment.
ai-mn118:9.2_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:10.1_0: In this Saṅgha there are mendicants who, with the ending of the five lower fetters are reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.
ai-mn118:10.2_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:11.1_0: In this Saṅgha there are mendicants who, with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, are once-returners. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.
ai-mn118:11.2_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:12.1_0: In this Saṅgha there are mendicants who, with the ending of three fetters are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
ai-mn118:12.2_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:13.1_0: In this Saṅgha there are mendicants who are committed to developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation ...
ai-mn118:13.2_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:14.2_0: the four bases of psychic power ...
ai-mn118:14.7_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:14.8_0: In this Saṅgha there are mendicants who are committed to developing the meditation on love ...
ai-mn118:14.14_0: There are such mendicants in this Saṅgha.
ai-mn118:14.15_0: In this Saṅgha there are mendicants who are committed to developing the meditation on mindfulness of breathing.
ai-mn118:15.1_0: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated, is very fruitful and beneficial.
ai-mn118:15.2_0: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated, fulfills the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-mn118:15.3_0: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, fulfill the seven awakening factors.
ai-mn118:15.4_0: And the seven awakening factors, when developed and cultivated, fulfill knowledge and freedom.
ai-mn118:16.1_0: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
ai-mn118:17.1_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
ai-mn118:17.2_0: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out.
ai-mn118:18.1_0: When breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’ When breathing out heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing out heavily.’
ai-mn118:18.3_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the whole body. They practice breathing out experiencing the whole body.
ai-mn118:19.1_0: They practice breathing in experiencing rapture. They practice breathing out experiencing rapture.
ai-mn118:19.3_0: They practice breathing in experiencing these emotions. They practice breathing out experiencing these emotions.
ai-mn118:20.1_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the mind. They practice breathing out experiencing the mind.
ai-mn118:20.3_0: or immersing the mind in samādhi,
ai-mn118:21.1_0: They practice breathing in observing impermanence. They practice breathing out observing impermanence.
ai-mn118:22.1_0: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.
ai-mn118:23.1_0: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?
ai-mn118:24.1_0: Whenever a mendicant knows that they breathe heavily,
ai-mn118:24.3_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the whole body. They practice breathing out experiencing the whole body.
ai-mn118:24.5_0: at that time they’re meditating by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:24.6_0: For I say that the in-breaths and out-breaths are an aspect of the body.
ai-mn118:24.7_0: That’s why at that time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:25.1_0: Whenever a mendicant practices breathing while experiencing rapture,
ai-mn118:25.3_0: They practice breathing in experiencing these emotions. They practice breathing out experiencing these emotions.
ai-mn118:25.5_0: at that time they meditate observing an aspect of feelings—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:25.6_0: For I say that close attention to the in-breaths and out-breaths is an aspect of feelings.
ai-mn118:25.7_0: That’s why at that time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of feelings—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:26.1_0: Whenever a mendicant practices breathing while experiencing the mind,
ai-mn118:26.3_0: or immersing the mind in samādhi,
ai-mn118:26.5_0: at that time they meditate observing an aspect of the mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:26.6_0: Because there is no situational awareness.
ai-mn118:26.7_0: That’s why at that time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:27.1_0: Whenever a mendicant practices breathing while observing impermanence,
ai-mn118:27.5_0: at that time they meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:27.6_0: Having seen with wisdom the giving up of desire and aversion, they watch closely over with equanimity.
ai-mn118:27.7_0: That’s why at that time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn118:28.1_0: That’s how mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated, fulfills the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-mn118:29.1_0: And how are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the seven awakening factors?
ai-mn118:30.1_0: Whenever a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, at that time their mindfulness is established and lucid.
ai-mn118:30.2_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of mindfulness;
ai-mn118:31.1_0: As they live mindfully in this way they investigate, explore, and inquire into that principle with wisdom.
ai-mn118:32.1_0: As they investigate principles with wisdom in this way their energy is roused up and unflagging.
ai-mn118:32.2_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of energy; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:33.1_0: For one who is energetic, spiritual rapture arises,
ai-mn118:33.2_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of rapture; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:34.1_0: When the mind is full of rapture, the body and mind become tranquil.
ai-mn118:34.2_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of tranquility; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:35.1_0: For one with a tranquil body and happiness his mind becomes concentrated,
ai-mn118:36.1_0: They closely watch over that mind immersed in samādhi.
ai-mn118:37.1_0: Whenever a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of feelings ...
ai-mn118:38.1_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-mn118:38.2_0: principles, at that time their mindfulness is established and lucid.
ai-mn118:38.3_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of mindfulness; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:38.4_0: As they live mindfully in this way they investigate, explore, and inquire into that principle with wisdom.
ai-mn118:38.6_0: As they investigate principles with wisdom in this way their energy is roused up and unflagging.
ai-mn118:38.7_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of energy; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:38.8_0: For one who is energetic, spiritual rapture arises,
ai-mn118:38.9_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of rapture; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:38.10_0: When the mind is full of rapture, the body and mind become tranquil.
ai-mn118:38.11_0: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of tranquility; they develop it and perfect it.
ai-mn118:38.12_0: For one with a tranquil body and happiness his mind becomes concentrated,
ai-mn118:39.1_0: They closely watch over that mind immersed in samādhi.
ai-mn118:40.1_0: That’s how the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, fulfill the seven awakening factors.
ai-mn118:41.1_0: And how are the seven awakening factors developed and cultivated so as to fulfill knowledge and freedom?
ai-mn118:42.1_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness,
ai-mn118:42.2_0: They develop the awakening factor of investigation of principles ...
ai-mn118:42.7_0: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
ai-mn118:43.1_0: That’s how the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated so as to fulfill knowledge and freedom.”
ai-mn118:43.2_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn118:43.3_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn118:43.4_0: The eighth section on mindfulness of breathing is finished.
